alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Licking (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 4:14PM EST until February 19 at 12:30AM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers... South Fork Licking River below I 70 near Buckeye Lake. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Fork Licking River below I 70 near Buckeye Lake. * WHEN...Until early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 880.0 feet, Water extends onto the 129A exit ramp from eastbound Interstate 70 to Route 79 near Buckeye Lake. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 PM EST Friday the stage was 880.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:45 PM EST Friday was 880.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 872.3 feet early Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 880.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to developments by listening to NOAA Weather Radio. For additional details on river forecasts, visit water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=iln
